title.value: SpeechBrain-MOABB: An open-source Python library for benchmarking deep neural networks applied to EEG signals
title.justification: The title of the paper explicitly mentions 'SpeechBrain-MOABB' as an open-source Python library designed for benchmarking deep neural networks applied to EEG signals.
title.quote: To address these limitations, we introduce SpeechBrain-MOABB, a novel open-source toolkit carefully designed to facilitate the development of a comprehensive EEG decoding pipeline based on deep learning.

extractions.description: This paper introduces SpeechBrain-MOABB, an open-source Python library that provides a standardized experimental protocol for benchmarking deep neural networks in EEG decoding. It addresses the replicability crisis in EEG research by incorporating robust measures for hyperparameter search and performance evaluation, outperforming existing tools like MOABB and braindecode. It allows for comprehensive and replicable EEG decoding pipelines using deep learning, facilitating neuroscientific research with improved accuracy and transparency.

type.justification: The paper describes the implementation and evaluation of SpeechBrain-MOABB, an open-source toolkit, providing empirical results by comparing it with existing tools, consistent with an empirical study.
type.quote: Remarkably, EEGNet-like architectures have consistently outperformed other CNNs, deep neural networks, and traditional machine learning methods in international scientific competitions.

name.justification: The research focuses on EEG decoding and improving brain-computer interfaces, which are central topics in the field of neuroscience.
name.quote: Deep learning has revolutionized EEG decoding, showcasing its ability to outperform traditional machine learning models.

name.justification: The paper emphasizes EEG decoding for Brain-Computer Interfaces, discussing methods for improving decoding accuracies using deep learning.
name.quote: Most successful applications regard the design of accurate neural decoders for Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCIs).

name.justification: The study revolves around EEG decoding, which is a fundamental aspect of electroencephalography.
name.quote: A novel open-source toolkit carefully designed to facilitate the development of a comprehensive EEG decoding pipeline based on deep learning.

name.justification: The paper mentions EEGNet explicitly as a model included in SpeechBrain-MOABB for EEG decoding, highlighting its effectiveness across various tasks.
name.quote: SpeechBrain-MOABB natively includes popular EEG models like EEGNet.

is_contributed.justification: EEGNet is not presented as a new model developed by this paper but rather as an existing neural network architecture included and benchmarked within SpeechBrain-MOABB.
is_contributed.quote: SpeechBrain-MOABB natively includes popular EEG models like EEGNet.

is_executed.justification: EEGNet is executed as part of the benchmarking effort within the SpeechBrain-MOABB toolkit.
is_executed.quote: The performance achieved with EEGNet using SpeechBrain-MOABB is presented.

is_compared.justification: EEGNet is evaluated against other neural network models and machine learning frameworks to demonstrate the capabilities of SpeechBrain-MOABB.
is_compared.quote: The paper compares EEGNet-based pipelines to other models, demonstrating improvements in accuracy.

referenced_paper_title.value: EEGNet: a compact convolutional neural network for EEG-based brain窶田omputer interfaces
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is cited in the context of discussing EEGNet's inclusion within SpeechBrain-MOABB.
referenced_paper_title.quote: V.J. Lawhern, EEGNet: a compact convolutional neural network for EEG-based brain窶田omputer interfaces.

name.justification: The paper mentions ShallowConvNet as part of the models native to the SpeechBrain-MOABB toolkit, focusing on its application in EEG decoding.

is_contributed.justification: ShallowConvNet is included within SpeechBrain-MOABB as an existing model rather than being a new contribution of this paper.

is_executed.justification: ShallowConvNet is used within the experiments conducted with SpeechBrain-MOABB to demonstrate deep learning applications in EEG decoding.
is_executed.quote: Furthermore, we also include ShallowConvNet (in models/ShallowConvNet.py).

is_compared.justification: ShallowConvNet's performance is evaluated and compared within the SpeechBrain-MOABB framework against other models.
is_compared.quote: Panels display performance distributions for decoding pipelines based on different neural network architectures like EEGNet, ShallowConvNet, etc.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep learning with convolutional neural networks for EEG decoding and visualization
referenced_paper_title.justification: ShallowConvNet, a model highlighted in the cited paper, is implemented and analyzed in the context of EEG decoding using SpeechBrain-MOABB.
referenced_paper_title.quote: R.T. Schirrmeister, Deep learning with convolutional neural networks for EEG decoding and visualization.

name.justification: EEGConformer is described as part of the SpeechBrain-MOABB toolkit, aimed at enhancing EEG decoding via transformer networks.
name.quote: EEGConformer, a recent transformer proposed for motor imagery and emotion decoding.

is_contributed.justification: EEGConformer is discussed as an existing model extended in SpeechBrain-MOABB, not as a new model introduced by this work.

is_executed.justification: EEGConformer was used in experiments within SpeechBrain-MOABB to analyze its EEG decoding capability.
is_executed.quote: Furthermore, we also include EEGConformer (in models/EEGConformer.py).

is_compared.justification: EEGConformer's processing and performance are compared against other networks within the experimental setup of this paper.
is_compared.quote: Benchmark results...using EEGNet, ShallowConvNet, and EEGConformer.

referenced_paper_title.value: EEG Conformer: Convolutional transformer for EEG decoding and visualization
referenced_paper_title.justification: EEGConformer is cited in the paper as a model tested for EEG decoding in SpeechBrain-MOABB.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Y. Song, EEG Conformer: Convolutional transformer for EEG decoding and visualization.

name.justification: The paper frequently references BNCI2014-001 to demonstrate the application and performance of the SpeechBrain-MOABB toolkit in decoding EEG signals for motor imagery tasks.
name.quote: Here, we focus on decoding motor imagery from the EEG using the BNCI2014-001 dataset, commonly known as 'BCI IV2a'.

referenced_paper_title.value: Review of the BCI competition IV
referenced_paper_title.justification: The BNCI2014-001 dataset is linked to the BCI competition IV, as cited in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: M. Tangermann, Review of the BCI competition IV.

name.justification: Lee2019-MI dataset is used in the research to assess the effectiveness of EEG decoding models integrated into SpeechBrain-MOABB.
name.quote: In this dataset, 62-channel EEG was recorded from 54 healthy participants across 2 recording sessions.

referenced_paper_title.value: EEG dataset and OpenBMI toolbox for three BCI paradigms: an investigation into BCI illiteracy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Lee2019-MI dataset is cited in the context of its use within the SpeechBrain-MOABB experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: M.-H. Lee, EEG dataset and OpenBMI toolbox for three BCI paradigms: an investigation into BCI illiteracy.

name.justification: The paper references the EPFLP300 dataset as part of the empirical study using SpeechBrain-MOABB, particularly for P300-based BCI applications.
name.quote: EPFLP300 dataset consists of 32-channel EEG recorded from 9 participants across 4 recording sessions.

referenced_paper_title.value: An efficient P300-based brain窶田omputer interface for disabled subjects
referenced_paper_title.justification: EPFLP300's use is highlighted with reference to its original publication, focusing on P300 applications within the SpeechBrain-MOABB toolkit.
referenced_paper_title.quote: U. Hoffmann, An efficient P300-based brain窶田omputer interface for disabled subjects.

name.justification: The paper introduces SpeechBrain-MOABB as the primary library developed and investigated, which standardizes EEG decoding using deep learning.
name.quote: We introduce SpeechBrain-MOABB, a novel open-source toolkit carefully designed to facilitate the development of a comprehensive EEG decoding pipeline based on deep learning.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is an extension or adaptation of SpeechBrain, initially designed for speech processing, to EEG applications.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This work proposes SpeechBrain-MOABB by extending SpeechBrain to accommodate EEG decoding.

name.justification: PyTorch is utilized within SpeechBrain-MOABB for implementing and running neural networks in the context of EEG decoding.
name.quote: SpeechBrain is a Python toolkit built on PyTorch.

referenced_paper_title.value: Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference provides credibility and source attribution for the foundational library used in SpeechBrain-MOABB.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A. Paszke, Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library.

name.justification: MOABB library is referenced as a core benchmark tool integrated into SpeechBrain-MOABB, allowing comparison with traditional EEG decoding methods.
name.quote: MOABB represents a reference tool for neuroscientists, for benchmarking traditional machine learning on public EEG datasets.

referenced_paper_title.value: MOABB: trustworthy algorithm benchmarking for BCIs
referenced_paper_title.justification: SpeechBrain-MOABB is built upon and expands functionalities provided by the MOABB library.
referenced_paper_title.quote: V. Jayaram, MOABB: trustworthy algorithm benchmarking for BCIs.
